220-FileZilla Server 0.9.53 beta
220-written by Tim Kosse (tim.kosse@filezilla-project.org)
220 Please visit https://filezilla-project.org/
530 This server does not allow plain FTP. You have to use FTP over TLS.
214-The following commands are recognized:
   ABOR   ADAT   ALLO   APPE   AUTH   CDUP   CLNT   CWD 
   DELE   EPRT   EPSV   FEAT   HASH   HELP   LIST   MDTM
   MFMT   MKD    MLSD   MLST   MODE   NLST   NOOP   NOP 
   OPTS   P@SW   PASS   PASV   PBSZ   PORT   PROT   PWD 
   QUIT   REST   RETR   RMD    RNFR   RNTO   SITE   SIZE
   STOR   STRU   SYST   TYPE   USER   XCUP   XCWD   XMKD
   XPWD   XRMD
214 Have a nice day.
211-Features:
 MDTM
 REST STREAM
 SIZE
 MLST type*;size*;modify*;
 MLSD
 AUTH SSL
 AUTH TLS
 PROT
 PBSZ
 UTF8
 CLNT
 MFMT
 EPSV
 EPRT
211 End

http.title: Fayetteville, NC | Home
http.html:
Show/Hide

Downtown Parking Information  - Regular & Event Day Parking

Click here for downtown parking information including all public lots and areas designated for handicapped-accessible parking. The Fayetteville Area System of Transit (FAST) will also provide affordable, fast and convenient access to the downtown area for the City’s opening day Minor League Baseball game at Segra Stadium and all games thereafter. We want citizens to feel welcomed and be encouraged to return for future downtown events.

Watch a Video Tour of Our City

Around the City

  • The City of Fayetteville’s government administrative offices, including City Hall, are closed on Friday, April 19 in recognition of Good Friday and Easter. Click here for schedules for resident service-focused departments.
  • The City, County and PWC were among 28 North Carolina governments to earn recognition in the 12th North Carolina City & County Communicators’ (NC3C) Excellence in Communications Awards. The local organizations won a combined 11 awards. Click here for more information.
  • City of Fayetteville staff will constantly monitor the downtown parking process during large events, making adjustments as needed, while ensuring citizen safety and security.  We want citizens to feel welcomed and be encouraged to return for future downtown events. Click here for information about regular and event parking downtown. 
  • Learn how to protect your property and improve the natural environment by stabilizing the stream on your property at a free Streambank Repair Workshop hosted by the City! Learn from NC State University experts about practical, cost-effective solutions using natural materials and native plants to create a healthy stream-side environment. Click here for more information.
